Public Functions

These are functions that everyone can access.

.
debug_printf
void debug_printf(string fmt,
mixed args ...)
This method will generate a debug inform for any creators in the room where it is generated. It will always attempt to identify the room that the event should be sent to.

Parameters:
all - printf style parameters
See also:
printf .c
Example: 
#ifdef DEBUG
  debug_printf("Error, player is: %O\n", player);
#endif
tell_creator
varargs void tell_creator(mixed cres,
string fmt,
mixed args ...)
This method writes a message to a creator, it's mainly meant for debug messages where sending a message to a specific creator is smarter than sending it to players, who will only get confused. Typically you should use debug_printf() instead of this.

Parameters:
cre - the name or object to send the message to
fmt - the format string
args - the arguments to the sprintf
See also:
debug_printf .c
